intro: Jacea macroptilon subsp. oxylepis, commonly known as the yellow oxylepis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
